moves.1. c4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. g3 d5: better was e6 to consolidate your centre and prevent d5
moves.6. d5 Nb4 7. e4: and now the centre is mine
moves.7... b5: there are more important things to do than protect c4. eg Bg4 or Nd3+
moves.8. a3 Qa5 9. e5 Nfxd5: should take with the other N - Nbxd5. gets your N out of trouble and opens a diagonal to the K for your Q
moves.10. axb4 Qxa1: correct was Nxc3 offering a Q swap. But taking the R is a really bad move. When a piece is offered for free then you should look for the hook inside it.
moves.11. Nxd5 Bd7: better was f6 opening an escape line for the K
moves.12. Nc7+ Kd8 13. e6 Kxc7: just sets things up for a check with discovered attack on the Q. Desperation measure was Qxc1 getting rid of my B and forcing the Q off the d-file
moves.14. Bf4+ Kb6: better was Kd8 or Kb7 Puts the K in a better place
moves.15. Qxa1: and now whatever you play it is soon mate
